history.p: In the beginning of 1893, Carl Nielsen was requested to compose music to Holger Drachmann's play Snefrid in connection with a planned performance at Det frie Theater. In less than a month the score was finished. The plans for a production at the theatre came to nothing, however, and the music was not performed until the following year. The music was later revised and arranged by Nielsen himself. Music from no. 4 was re-used in Hr. Oluf han rider– CNW 7 (1906) and Amor og Digteren CNW 23 (1929).

history.p: In 1899, Dagmarteatret planned a stage performance of Snefrid, and for this production Nielsen revised and expanded the music.

history.p: In 1902, Nielsen arranged the entire music for piano quintet to be played by musicians from the Royal Danish Orchestra (Det Kongelige Kapel) on a concert tour.

Claussen, / Drachmann, / Holstein, / Levy, Michaëlis, Rafael, / Schandorph. / Prosa af A.E. Betzonich, / Hjernø, Alfred Ipsen, / Joh.s Jørgensen, My- / lius-Erichsen, Stucken- / berg. / Kritik. / Musik af Carl Nielsen. / N.M. Kjærs Forlag / Döcker & Kjær / Köbenhavn

annot.p: Printed in Illustreret Kalender for 1893. Udgiven af Journalistforeningen i København, pp. 56–86.
